intro: Hieracium queraltense, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disk-like structure. Hieracium queraltense is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
